docs.snippet: Mr. Schumacher advocated a market-based, gentrifying approach to housing that would effectively displace working-class, lower-income, residents from city centers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Schumacher advocated a market-based, gentrifying approach to housing that would effectively displace working-class, lower-income, residents from city centers.
docs.abstract: Zaha Hadid Architects issues open letter distancing firm from remarks made by principal architect Patrik Schumacher at World Architecture Festival, in which he advocated market-based, gentrifying approach to affordable housing.

headline.main: Zaha Hadid’s Firm Distances Itself From Patrik Schumacher’s Words
headline.print_headline: Hadid Firm Takes Issue With Leader’s Comments

docs.snippet: China is reopening mines amid worries about power supplies, demonstrating how difficult it will be to wean its giant economy from coal dependence....
docs.lead_paragraph: China is reopening mines amid worries about power supplies, demonstrating how difficult it will be to wean its giant economy from coal dependence.
docs.abstract: China is scrambling to mine and burn more coal, responding to diminishing stockpiles and fears of electricity blackouts, even as it assumes leading role in fight against climate change; response to coal scarcity points to difficulty of weaning country off coal and of meeting worldwide emissions targets; Chinese coal is world’s largest single source of carbon emissions from human activities.

headline.main: Despite Climate Change Vow, China Pushes to Dig More Coal
headline.print_headline: Despite Climate Vow, China Scrambles for Coal

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Beijing. Ailin Tang contributed research.
